info.title: CTS API 1.0
info.description:
CTS Realtime API.
You must fill the username field of the Basic HTTP Auth Header with your token.
To get a token, connect to your open data account.

Please make good use of the API and do not make an excessive number of requests.
The stop-monitoring and estimated-timetable APIs contain the elements ValidUntil and ShortestPossibleCycle to help you determine when it may be useful to make a new request.
All APIs also return the cache-control HTTP header, letting you know how long the response can at least be considered valid. Any request made before the expiration of this period will return the same response.
In the event of an abusive request not respecting these rules, an HTTP error code may be returned.

get.summary:
Estimated Timetable service is used to inform interested schedule information systems of the current status of all known VEHICLE JOURNEYs.
All VEHICLE JOURNEYs currently running and all those that start in the hour are returned.
get.description:
A EstimatedTimetableDelivery is made up of EstimatedTimetableVersionFrame instances, each representing a schedule of DATED VEHICLE JOURNEY for a LINE and DIRECTION.
Each production timetable is returned as an EstimatedTimetableVersionFrame element. Each Estimated-TimetableVersionFrame comprises one or more EstimatedVehicleJourney elements grouped for a version of the timetable.
Each EstimatedVehicleJourney contains an ordered list of EstimatedCall elements, as well as other properties.
Each EstimatedCall describes the estimated future times at a stop. A journey shall contain at least two CALLs of any type.
ExpectedDepartureTime is the value to show to the clients for real time application.
PublishedLineName is the value to show to the client for the line number. It is more precise that LineRef.
If there is a VIA, you have to concatenante it with the DestinationName using the "via" keyword. Like "[DestinationName] via [Via]", eg. "Neuhof Stéphanie via Stade Walter".

parameters.name: RequestorRef
parameters.description: Identifier of Requestor. May be used to identify an individual participant system or individual device client. If used for a device client should be an anonymous token, divulged with user consent.

parameters.name: MessageIdentifier
parameters.description: Arbitrary identifier that may be given to message. Will be returned in response.

parameters.name: VehicleMode
parameters.description: A method of transportation, possible values : bus, tram, undefined. Default = undefined.

parameters.name: PreviewInterval
parameters.description: Forward duration for which Stop Visits should be included, that is, interval before predicted arrival at the stop for which to include visits: only journeys which will arrive or depart within this time span will be returned. ISO-8601 duration format, eg: PT30M = 30 minutes. Default/maximum = 2 hours.

parameters.name: LineRef
parameters.description: Filter the results to include only Stop Visits for VEHICLEs for the given LINES.

parameters.name: DirectionRef
parameters.description:
Filter the results to include only visits for VEHICLEs going to the specified DIRECTION.
A DIRECTION is a relative sense of traversal of a ROUTE (for example inbound/outbound, clockwise/anticlockwise).
Possible values : 0 / 1
Equivalent to the direction_id on trip trips.txt GTFS file.
You must use this value instead of the DestinationName for any favorits mechanisms.

parameters.name: IncludeGeneralMessage
parameters.description: If true, GeneralMessageDelivery will be included (same as siri/2.0/general-message webservice)

parameters.name: IncludeFLUO67
parameters.description: If true, stop visits from FLUO67 vehicles will also be returned. Default = false.

parameters.name: RemoveCheckOut
parameters.description: If true, "old" departures are not returned. Default = false

parameters.name: GetStopIdInsteadOfStopCode
parameters.description: If true : StopPointRef will be the stop_id of the GTFS, otherwise the stop_code. Default = false

400.description: Bad request, missing or wrong parameter

500.description: Technical error - Please try again later

get.summary: Returns messages about traffic information, modify services, commercial information...
get.description:
ItemIdentifier stay the same and is linked to the disruption.
InfoMessageIdentifier change every time the disruption is updated.
The customer could be inform of a disruption before the ImpactStartDateTime, to anticipate the disruption. You can display the disruption as soon as you have it.
If you want to send notifications to customers : use Priority (and check instructions on SendUpdatedNotificationsToCustomers).

parameters.name: RequestorRef
parameters.description: Identifier of Requestor. May be used to identify an individual participant system or individual device client. If used for a device client should be an anonymous token, divulged with user consent.

parameters.name: MessageIdentifier
parameters.description: Arbitrary identifier that may be given to message. Will be returned in response.

parameters.name: InfoChannelRef
parameters.description: Filter the results based on the InfoChannel to which message belongs. If empty you'll receive everything. Values can be Disruption, PlannedDisruption, Information, Works.

parameters.name: LineRef
parameters.description: Filter the results to include only messages for the given LINEs.

parameters.name: ImpactedLineRef
parameters.description: Filter the results to include only messages for the given Impacted lines.

400.description: Bad request, missing or wrong parameter

500.description: Technical error - Please try again later

get.summary: Returns a list of all lines
get.description: Use a cache and respect ValidUntil and ShortestPossibleCycle parameters.

parameters.name: RequestorRef
parameters.description: Identifier of Requestor. May be used to identify an individual participant system or individual device client. If used for a device client should be an anonymous token, divulged with user consent.

parameters.name: MessageIdentifier
parameters.description: Arbitrary identifier that may be given to message. Will be returned in response.

400.description: Bad request, missing or wrong parameter

500.description: Technical error - Please try again later

get.summary: Returns a list of park and ride with available spots

500.description: Technical error - Please try again later

get.summary: Returns a list of retail outlet

parameters.name: TicketSales
parameters.description: Filter retail outlets that sell tickets

parameters.name: BadgeoTopUp
parameters.description: Filter retail outlets that can top up Badgéo cards

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Filter retail outlets by type (comma separated list)

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Use to get retail outlets around a coordinate. You muse provide latitude, longitude and distance to use it

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Use to get retail outlets around a coordinate. You muse provide latitude, longitude and distance to use it

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: Distance in meter around the latitude/longitude parameters. Use to get retail outlets around a coordinate. You muse provide latitude, longitude and distance to use it

500.description: Technical error - Please try again later

get.summary: Returns a list of retail outlet types

500.description: Technical error - Please try again later

get.summary: Stop Monitoring service provides a stop-centric view of VEHICLE departures (in realtime) at a list of designated stops.
get.description:
A StopMonitoringDelivery is made up of MonitoredStopVisit instances, each representing a CALL at the SCHEDULED STOP POINT by a VEHICLE.
Each MonitoredStopVisit contains a set of subelements describing the VEHICLE’s visit to the stop, including scheduled and/or real-time times, and also a MonitoredVehicleJourney element, which describes the VEHICLE’s route and associations with the DatedVehicleJourney that it follows, and other entities.
ExpectedDepartureTime is the value to show to the clients for real time application.
PublishedLineName is the value to show to the client for the line number. It is more precise that LineRef.
If there is a VIA, you have to concatenate it with the DestinationName using the "via" keyword. Like "[DestinationName] via [Via]", eg. "Neuhof Stéphanie via Stade Walter".

parameters.name: MonitoringRef
parameters.description:
Reference to one or multiple Stop Monitoring point for which Stop Visits will be returned.
Recommended values : StopCode or LogicalStopCode from stoppoints-discovery API.
The LogicalStopCode represent the whole stop (all directions), the StopCode represent the physical stop ("one side" of the road, precise direction).
The LogicalStopCode is the same as the StopCode but without the letter at the end, eg: 13A (StopCode) - 13 (LogicalStopCode).
The StopCode is the stop_code field on the GTFS stops.txt file.

parameters.name: RequestorRef
parameters.description: Identifier of Requestor. May be used to identify an individual participant system or individual device client. If used for a device client should be an anonymous token, divulged with user consent.

parameters.name: MessageIdentifier
parameters.description: Arbitrary identifier that may be given to message. Will be returned in response.

parameters.name: VehicleMode
parameters.description: A method of transportation, possible values : bus, tram, undefined. Default = undefined.

parameters.name: PreviewInterval
parameters.description: Forward duration for which Stop Visits should be included, that is, interval before predicted arrival at the stop for which to include visits: only journeys which will arrive or depart within this time span will be returned. ISO-8601 duration format, eg: PT30M = 30 minutes. Default/maximum = 1h30.

parameters.name: StartTime
parameters.description: Initial start time for PreviewInterval. If absent, then current time is assumed. Must be within data Horizon (max 1h30 from current time). ISO-8601 duration format, eg: 2017-02-08T13:45:50+01:00.

parameters.name: LineRef
parameters.description: Filter the results to include only Stop Visits for VEHICLEs for the given LINE.

parameters.name: DirectionRef
parameters.description:
Filter the results to include only visits for VEHICLEs going to the specified DIRECTION.
A DIRECTION is a relative sense of traversal of a ROUTE (for example inbound/outbound, clockwise/anticlockwise).
Possible values : 0 / 1
Equivalent to the direction_id on trip trips.txt GTFS file.
You must use this value instead of the DestinationName for any favorits mechanisms.

parameters.name: MaximumStopVisits
parameters.description: The maximum number of arrival or departure visits to include in a given delivery. The first n Stop Visits within the look-ahead window are included. Only visits within the PreviewInterval are returned. Default = 3.

parameters.name: MinimumStopVisitsPerLine
parameters.description: The requested minimum number of arrival or departure visits to include in a given delivery. If there are more visits within the PreviewInterval than allowed by MaximumStopVisits, and a MinimumStopVisitsPerLine value is specified, then at least the minimum number will be delivered. That is, the first available visits within the PreviewInterval will be included, even if the Stop Visits are later than those for some other LINE for which the minimum number of Stop Visits has already been supplied. This allows the Consumer to obtain at least one entry for every available LINE with VEHICLEs approaching the stop. Only visits within the PreviewInterval are returned. Default = 3.

parameters.name: IncludeGeneralMessage
parameters.description: If true, GeneralMessageDelivery will be included (same as siri/2.0/general-message webservice)

parameters.name: IncludeFLUO67
parameters.description: If true, stop visits from FLUO67 vehicles will also be returned. Default = false.

400.description: Bad request, missing or wrong parameter

500.description: Technical error - Please try again later

get.summary: Returns a list of stop points
get.description: You can use StopCode or LogicalStopCode to request stop-monitoring.

parameters.name: RequestorRef
parameters.description: Identifier of Requestor. May be used to identify an individual participant system or individual device client. If used for a device client should be an anonymous token, divulged with user consent.

parameters.name: MessageIdentifier
parameters.description: Arbitrary identifier that may be given to message. Will be returned in response.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Use to get stops around a coordinate. You muse provide latitude, longitude and distance to use it

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Use to get stops around a coordinate. You muse provide latitude, longitude and distance to use it

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: Distance in meter around the latitude/longitude parameters. Use to get stops around a coordinate. You muse provide latitude, longitude and distance to use it

parameters.name: includeLinesDestinations
parameters.description: Use this paramater to get the lines passing at the stop and the destinations for each way

parameters.name: stopCode
parameters.description: Use this paramater to get informations. Will return all stops with the same logicalStopCode

400.description: Bad request, missing or wrong parameter

500.description: Technical error - Please try again later

get.summary: Returns links to the timetables files for a stop

parameters.name: logicalStopCode
parameters.description: Logical stop code (as returned in stop-discovery)

500.description: Technical error - Please try again later
Technical error - Please try again later

DirectionRef.description:
A DIRECTION is a relative sense of traversal of a ROUTE (for example inbound/outbound, clockwise/anticlockwise).
Possible values : 0 / 1
Equivalent to the direction_id on trip trips.txt GTFS file.
You must use this value instead of the DestinationName for any favorits mechanisms.

DestinationName.description: The name of the possible destinations for a DirectionRef

Destinations.description: List of Direction and possible Destinations for each Direction

Lines.description: List of Lines which desserve this stop

ImpactStartDateTime.description:
Start datetime of the perturbation. If you receive this message, you should start displaying it, even if the perturbation as not started yet (to inform the users)
The period MessageText should be use instead of ImpactStartDateTime if you want to display dates to the user

ImpactEndDateTime.description:
End datetime of the perturbation, can be null if not know
The period MessageText should be use instead of ImpactStartDateTime if you want to display dates to the user

ImpactedGroupOfLinesRef.description: Indicate that the message concern the whole network and not a list of Lines. Possible value : null or CTS.

ImpactedLineRef.description: List of impacted Lines. Can be null, in this case refers to ImpactedGroupOfLinesRef.

TypeOfPassengerEquipmentRef.description: Type of equipment that should use this message. By default : WEB

SendUpdatedNotificationsToCustomers.description:
Use this value to know if customers should be notified again when the message change (ie when the InfoMessageIdentifier change and the content change).
This flag is only used when a notification has already been send, to know if it should be send again when a upate happened.
If false : disruption should still be show on mobile app or website, but without new notification.

StopPointRef.description: Contains short text or a number that uniquely identifies the stop for passengers. Same as StopCode on stoppoints-discovery

DestinationName.description: The name of the destination of the journey; used to help identify the VEHICLE to the public

DestinationShortName.description: Name or Number by which the LINE is known to the public, used for small screens

Via.description: Description of a VIA point on a journey. If there is a VIA, you have to concatenante it with the DestinationName using the "via" keyword. Like "[DestinationName] via [Via]", eg. "Neuhof Stéphanie via Stade Walter"

ExpectedDepartureTime.description: Time of departure of VEHICLE. Can be Estimated (realtime) or not (aimed, theorical)

ExpectedArrivalTime.description: Estimated time of arrival of VEHICLE. Can be Estimated (realtime) or not (aimed, theorical)

ValidUntil.description: End of data horizon of the data producer. No need to request again before this date. You can also use the cache-control HTTP Header

ShortestPossibleCycle.description: Minimum interval at which updates can be sent

EstimatedJourneyVersionFrame.description: Provides a schedule of DATED VEHICLE JOURNEY for a LINE and DIRECTION.

RecordedAtTime.description: Time at which data was recorded

EstimatedVehicleJourney.description: Provides real-time information about a VEHICLE JOURNEY along which a VEHICLE is running.

LineRef.description: Reference to a LINE, based on the route_id column of the routes.txt GTFS file.

DirectionRef.description:
A DIRECTION is a relative sense of traversal of a ROUTE (for example inbound/outbound, clockwise/anticlockwise).
Possible values : 0 / 1
Equivalent to the direction_id on trip trips.txt GTFS file.
You must use this value instead of the DestinationName for any favorits mechanisms.

PublishedLineName.description: Name or Number by which the LINE is known to the public. Should be use on screen instead of LineRef.

IsCompleteStopSequence.description: Whether the above CALL sequence is complete, i.e. represents every CALL of the route and so can be used to replace a previous CALL sequence

EstimatedCalls.description: Complete sequence of stops along the route path, in calling order

RouteColor.description: Hexadecimal value of the line color

RouteTextColor.description: Hexadecimal value of the text line color

StopCode.description: Client stop code, recommendated to request the StopMonitoring API. This code identify the stop with a precise direction ("one side" of the road).

LogicalStopCode.description: Client stop code, recommendated to request the StopMonitoring API. This code identify the stop with all directions.

IsFlexhopStop.description: Indicates that this stop is served by the Flexhop service  https://www.cts-strasbourg.eu/fr/se-deplacer/transport-a-la-demande/

distance.description:
Distance (in meter) between the coordinates indicated by the parameters latitude/longitude and the stop.
Value only present if the latitude/longitude/distance parameters are used.

IsRealTime.description: Indicate if the departure and arrival time are realtime or not

IsCheckOut.description: Indicate that the departure is "old" and should no longer be displayed (eg : the vehicle has passed)

IsRealTime.description: Indicate if the departure and arrival time are realtime or not

Experimentation.description: If not null, indicates the current experiment in the vehicle

DatedVehicleJourneySAERef.description: A reference to the DATED VEHICLE JOURNEY that the VEHICLE is making. Dedicated to the SAE, cannot match the GTFS trips

ShortestPossibleCycle.description: Minimum interval at which updates can be sent

formatRef.description: Identifies the format of the content. The value will always be "CTS"

ItemIdentifier.description: Identifier of the situation (can be used to reference it). All updates of a message will have the same ItemIdentifier.

InfoMessageIdentifier.description: Unique identifier of the message. An update of a message will generate a new InfoMessageIdentifier.

InfoChannelRef.description: InfoChannel to which message belongs. Value can be Disruption, PlannedDisruption, Works, Information.

ValidUntilTime.description: Time until which message is valid. This is not the value to show to users for the end of the perturbation. This time can be updated. If the end is not know = end of the exploitation day.

RequestMessageRef.description: Reference to a unique message identifier associated with the request which gave rise to this response

ValidUntil.description: End of data horizon of the data producer

ShortestPossibleCycle.description: Minimum interval at which updates can be sent

MessageZoneRef.description: Zone to use for this message. For the WEB, three possibility : title, details and period. The period MessageText should be use to displays dates to the user, instead of ImpactStartDateTime and ImpactEndDateTime

MessageText.description: List of messages for each language

StopCode.description: Contains short text or a number that uniquely identifies the stop for passengers.

Order.description: Order number of the stop in the vehicle journey

ExpectedDepartureTime.description: Time of departure of VEHICLE. Can be Estimated (realtime) or not (aimed, theorical)

ExpectedArrivalTime.description: Estimated time of arrival of VEHICLE. Can be Estimated (realtime) or not (aimed, theorical)

RecordedAtTime.description: Time at which data was recorded

MonitoringRef.description: Reference to a Stop Monitoring point at which visits happen

StopCode.description: Contains short text or a number that uniquely identifies the stop for passengers.

LineRef.description: Reference to a LINE, based on the route_id column of the routes.txt GTFS file.

DirectionRef.description:
A DIRECTION is a relative sense of traversal of a ROUTE (for example inbound/outbound, clockwise/anticlockwise).
Possible values : 0 / 1
Equivalent to the direction_id on trip trips.txt GTFS file.
You must use this value instead of the DestinationName for any favorits mechanisms.

PublishedLineName.description: Name or Number by which the LINE is known to the public. Should be use on screen instead of LineRef.

DestinationName.description: The name of the destination of the journey; used to help identify the VEHICLE to the public

DestinationShortName.description: Name or Number by which the LINE is known to the public, used for small screens

Via.description: Description of a VIA point on a journey. If there is a VIA, you have to concatenante it with the DestinationName using the "via" keyword. Like "[DestinationName] via [Via]", eg. "Neuhof Stéphanie via Stade Walter"

PreviousCall.description: The PreviousCall element describes a list of CALL which has already been made in the MonitoredVehicleJourney.

OnwardCall.description: The OnwardCall element describes a list of CALL which has still to be made in the MonitoredVehicleJourney.

StopCode.description: Contains short text or a number that uniquely identifies the stop for passengers.

Order.description: Order number of the stop in the vehicle journey

ExpectedDepartureTime.description: Time of departure of VEHICLE. Can be Estimated (realtime) or not (aimed, theorical)

ExpectedArrivalTime.description: Estimated time of arrival of VEHICLE. Can be Estimated (realtime) or not (aimed, theorical)

Designation.description: Designation of the park and ride

Longitude.description: Longitude of the park and ride, WGS84 format

Latitude.description: Latitude of the park and ride, WGS84 format

LastUpdate.description: Last time the real time data was updated

TotalParkingSpots.description: Total spots on the park and ride

AvailableParkingSpots.description: Current available spots on the park and ride

Open.description: Indicates if the park and ride is open or close

StopCode.description: Contains short text or a number that uniquely identifies the stop for passengers.

Order.description: Order number of the stop in the vehicle journey

Longitude.description: Longitude of the retail outlet, WGS84 format

Latitude.description: Latitude of the retail outlet, WGS84 format

OpeningTimes.description: Opening times of the retail outlet

TicketSales.description: Indicates if the retail outlet sales tickets

BadgeoTopUp.description: Indicates if the retail outlet can topup Badgéo card

Services.description: List of services offered by the retail outlet

id.description: id of the retail outlet type

type.description: Name of the retail outlet type

RequestMessageRef.description: Reference to a unique message identifier associated with the request which gave rise to this response

ValidUntil.description: End of data horizon of the data producer. No need to request again before this date. You can also use the cache-control HTTP Header

ShortestPossibleCycle.description: Minimum interval at which updates can be sent

MonitoringRef.description: Reference to a Stop Monitoring point at which visits happen

MonitoredStopVisit.description: A visit to a SCHEDULED STOP POINT by a VEHICLE as a departure

RequestMessageRef.description: Reference to a unique message identifier associated with the request which gave rise to this response

AnnotatedStopPointRef.description: Delivery for Stop Points Discovery Service

StopCode.description: Client stop code, recommendated to request the StopMonitoring API. This code identify the stop with a precise direction ("one side" of the road).

StartValidity.description: Start of validity of the timetable

EndValidity.description: End of validity of the timetable

Longitude.description: Longitude of the velhop spot, WGS84 format

Latitude.description: Latitude of the velhop spot, WGS84 format

StationID.description: Station id, is null if the velhop spot is not a station

AvailableBikes.description: Available bikes, is null if the velhop spot is not a station

AvailableFreeBikeSpots.description: Available bike spots, is null if the velhop spot is not a station

TotalBikeSpots.description: Total bike spots, is null if the velhop spot is not a station

BankCard.description: Indicates if the automatic station accept bank card, is null if the velhop spot is not a station

Longitude.description: Longitude of the veloparc, WGS84 format

Latitude.description: Latitude of the veloparc, WGS84 format
